comments:
DecoratingLabelProvider.getImage can create a new Image with decorations. When those new images are used in calls to updateLabel(..) they are never disposed.

WPF builds of Eclipse can track the allocation of handles, and tell us which were not disposed when the Display is destroyed. Here is the trace from the creation of one of the leaked images:

LEAK -> 59=System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CachedBitmap type=System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CachedBitmap
java.lang.Exception
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.wpf.OS.BitmapSource_Create(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.init(Image.java:962)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.<init>(Image.java:417)
	at org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor.createImage(ImageDescriptor.java:291)
	at org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor.createImage(ImageDescriptor.java:227)
	at org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor.createImage(ImageDescriptor.java:205)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.OverlayCache.getImageFor(OverlayCache.java:34)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.OverlayCache.applyDescriptors(OverlayCache.java:64)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.DecorationResult.decorateWithOverlays(DecorationResult.java:84)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.DecorationScheduler.decorateWithOverlays(DecorationScheduler.java:180)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.DecoratorManager.decorateImage(DecoratorManager.java:367)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.DecoratingLabelProvider.getImage(DecoratingLabelProvider.java:89)
